> ```
> [$path=/^\/$/]bbs.pcbeta.com#?##toptb ~ #wp > *:not(div):not(style):not(ul):not(script) + div[class][id]:has(div[style="display:none"])
> ```
> 
> please test this rule with
> 
> ```
> bbs.pcbeta.com#@?##toptb ~ #wp > *:not(div):not(style):not(ul):not(script) + div[class][id]:has(div[style="display:none"])
> bbs.pcbeta.com#@?##toptb ~ #wp > *:not(div):not(style):not(ul):not(script) + div[class][id]:-abp-has(div[style="display:none"])
> ```

Now after I updated the filter to the latest version（2023-03-19 08:20PM GMT+8）, the site works fine, so can't test the rules above.

comment.body:
> Rule which hides it comes from Liste FR. So for hiding rule we only have to block the text `Sponsorisé`? First text `À la une` is also some kind of ad (translates to Featured)?
> 
> Please try this rule: `leboncoin.fr#@?#a[data-test-id]:-abp-has([class]:-abp-contains(/À la une|Sponsorisé|Urgent/))`

Adding the line to "My filters" seems to fix the issue, indeed.

"À la une" should not be blocked. It is not an ad, but a service some people pay to give more visibility to their listing (much like "Urgent"). Only "Sponsorisé" posts are actual ads, and should be blocked.

comment.body:
> "À la une" could be blocked but "urgent" ads do not have more visibility (in terms of ranking), they simply have a red outline and there's a fitler for them

Blocking "À la une" would mean entirely blocking user-made listings from search results. They're not ads. They're just highlights. Blocking the highlight would somewhate make sense (though it's an unnecessary hassle in my opinion), but blocking the listings entirely significantly affects the user experience.

You can do another small test: disable your adblock, and favourite a "À la une" listing, then go check your favourites with "À la une" blocked. The listing will not be visible anymore. That is not desirable behaviour: this means some listings could disappear from one's favourites just because the seller has paid for "À la une" in the meantime.
